meaning: सर्वगतः: omnipresent, present in all placesसर्वात्मा: encompasses all beings, the soul within allतथाप्ययं: nevertheless, despite this, yetHere, the verse is a statement made by the renowned philosopher and teacher, Shankaracharya. It highlights the concept of the divine being present everywhere and within all beings, yet it emphasizes the paradox or irony of this reality. The verse emphasizes the simultaneous presence of the divine in all aspects of existence while acknowledging the common human perspective that may overlook or fail to fully comprehend this truth.
